title: H-3 Nozzlenose D
paragraphs: The H-3 Nozzlenose D is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is the heavy version of the L-3 Nozzlenose D and an alternative version of the H-3 Nozzlenose.

The H-3 Nozzlenose D in Splatoon and Splatoon 2 is nearly identical in appearance to the H-3 Nozzlenose, with the only difference being the presence of an added decal of the dolphin logo associated with its brand on the hose.

In Splatoon 3, the H-3 Nozzlenose D has undergone a noticeable visual change, setting it further apart from its standard counterpart: its build is now significantly lighter in color, with most of the frame becoming white and all of the darker blue elements shifting to a significantly lighter shade. It retains the dolphin decal.
The H-3 Nozzlenose D was released on 30 October 2015 at 02:00 UTC.[1][2] Its kit consists of Point Sensor and Inkzooka.
- Promotional image
- An Inkling running with the H-3 Nozzlenose D
- Firing the H-3 Nozzlenose D (front)
- Firing the H-3 Nozzlenose D (behind)
- Official art of an Inkling holding the H-3 Nozzlenose D
- SplatNet icon
The H-3 Nozzlenose D was announced on 16 March 2018 at 09:00 UTC and released on 17 March 2018 at 02:00 UTC.[4] Its kit consists of Suction Bomb and Ink Armor.
Before being officially announced, the H-3 Nozzlenose D appeared in the Version 3.0.0 preview section of the 8 March 2018 Nintendo Direct.[5]

According to the Oatmealdome datamine from August 2017, the H-3 Nozzlenose D would have had Sprinkler as its sub weapon. However, a later update of the datamine showed the weapon with Suction Bomb, as did the final release.
- The results screen shows a player using the H-3 Nozzlenose D on the fifth line. This shows that the special for this set is Ink Armor
- A player (right) using the H-3 Nozzlenose D, clearly showing the longer snout and the dolphin sticker

The H-3 Nozzlenose D returned in Splatoon 3 as part of the Sizzle Season 2023 update, released on 1 June 2023. Before so, the weapon had received an official Twitter post from Nintendo on 22 May 2023 and its Tableturf Battle Card had been shown in the update's trailer. Its kit consists of Splash Wall and Big Bubbler, carrying on the tradition of giving the H-3 Nozzlenose Splash Wall and a protective special, but doing it on a different variant. Its overall design remains the same as the H-3 Nozzlenose, but with a white and blue color scheme and a Dolphin sticker. Its color scheme is very similar to the L-3 Nozzlenose D.

For competitive tips about the H-3 Nozzlenose D
The appended "D" in this weapon's name likely stands for "Dolphin", matching both the logo of its manufacturer and the dolphin theme of the base weapon's name in some languages.
